fields.description:
Currently, administrators can prevent significant details of their system from being shown in the 500page.jsp. However, the stack trace that this page shows still discloses a number of things to the user, including:
 * the fact that the application is using java,
 * the application code provider's company name,
 * the servlet container that the application is running in,
 * some of the libraries used, and
 * (for a more enterprising attacker) the versions of each that would match these stack trace elements.

Confluence should be changed to only show the user the stacktrace if the administrator has allowed it to be shown.
fields.summary: Allow administrator to prevent stack trace from being shown in 500page.jsp

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20566].
  {panel}

The Confluence documentation space uses the Documentation theme. A number of our pages include "What you need to type" and "What you will get" sections. In some cases, the output displayed in the "What you will get" section depends on the theme, and will therefore be different for customers who are using the default theme or any other theme.

We need to add a note (re-usable chunk) telling people that the output depends on the theme, and that our docs are using the Documentation theme.

A case in point is the *Panel Macro*. See comment on the doc page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Panel+Macro?focusedCommentId=222201832#comment-222201832
fields.summary: The Confluence documentation space uses the Documentation theme

fields.description:
When embedding an individual sheet of a published Google Docs Spreadsheet with this URL:

http://spreadsheets.google.com/pub?key=0Ame-zeuimXCXdDM0OG5UTml6cXJFakx1UEtzQk8xdEE&hl=en&single=true&gid=7&output=html

The connector changes the URL in the iframe to this (switches gid parameter to 0):

http://spreadsheets.google.com/pub?key=0Ame-zeuimXCXdDM0OG5UTml6cXJFakx1UEtzQk8xdEE&hl=en&single=true&gid=0&output=html

Which causes Google to show an error message, because we only published an individual sheet, not the whole spreadsheet document:

"We're sorry.

The publishing options given are not valid. Please check the options and try again."

I think there is no reason for changing the gid parameter to 0 by default. It would be great if this could be changed.
fields.summary: Published Google Spreadsheet does not work with individual sheet

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a page
# Insert the following text in Rich-Text Editor:
{noformat}
[this is 256 character. this is 256 character. this is 256 character. this is 256 character. this is 256 character. this is 256 character. this is 256 character. this is 256 character. this is 256 character. this is 256 character. thissssss is 256 character:test123]
{noformat}
# Save the page
# User will get a System Error page with the following error:
{noformat}
org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: could not insert: [com.atlassian.confluence.links.OutgoingLink#4784133]; SQL []; Data truncation: Data too long for column 'DESTSPACEKEY' at row 1; nested exception is com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'DESTSPACEKEY' at row 1
    at org.springframework.jdbc.support.SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator.java:110)

caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'DESTSPACEKEY' at row 1
    at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:3561)
{noformat}

h5. Workaround
# Add a space after the opening square bracket '[' or before the closing square bracket '['
or,
# Replace the colon ':' with:
{noformat}
:
{noformat}
or,
# Insert the text inside [Noformat Macro|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Noformat+Macro] or [Code Block Macro|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Code+Block+Macro].

h5. Findings
I think this happens because Rich-Text Editor will take square brackets '[ ]' as a link. So any characters before the colon ':' within the square brackets '[ ]' will be considered as a Space Key. If there are more than 255 characters for that part - ie. before colon ':' within the square brackets '[ ]', this will cause an error because {{DESTSPACEKEY}} column in {{LINKS}} table can only hold 255 characters value as shown below:
{noformat}
mysql> desc links;
+---------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
| Field         | Type         | Null | Key | Default | Extra |
+---------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
| LINKID        | bigint(20)   | NO   | PRI | NULL    |       |
| DESTPAGETITLE | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| DESTSPACEKEY  | varchar(255) | NO   | MUL | NULL    |       |
| CONTENTID     | bigint(20)   | NO   | MUL | NULL    |       |
| CREATOR       | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| CREATIONDATE  | datetime     | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| LASTMODIFIER  | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| LASTMODDATE   | datetime     | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
+---------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
{noformat}
This bug has been tested in MySQL, Postgre and SQL Server. But it seems to be not an issue in HSQL.
fields.summary: Inserting a text that contains a colon which is positioned after 256 characters within square brackets causes System Error page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20557].
  {panel}

h5. Bug Description

When you are importing word document using Office Connector's Doc Import function, if the space does not have a homepage set, you will get the following stacktrace:
{code}
Cause

java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.benryan.webwork.WordImportAction.doFileImport(WordImportAction.java:312)
Stack Trace:[hide]

java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.benryan.webwork.WordImportAction.doFileImport(WordImportAction.java:312)
at com.benryan.webwork.WordImportAction.executeFileImport(WordImportAction.java:146)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invokeAction(DefaultActionInvocation.java:302)
{code}

h5. Steps to reproduce
h6. In Confluence versions above 3.2
# First, ensure that the space that you are using does not have a homepage set.
# Next, go to any page, and use the "Import Word Document" feature
# Upload the word document you want to import
# Use the default setting:
{code:title=Example}
 Root page title: Test
 Where to import: Import as a new page in the current space
 Title conflicts: Rename imported pages if page name already exists
{code}
# Click {{Import}} button
# You will get the Oops page with the stacktrace mentioned above

h6. In Confluence 3.2 and below

# First, ensure that the space that you are using does not have a homepage set.
# Next, go to any page, and use the "Doc Import" feature
# Select the word document you want to import
# Click the {{Advanced}} button
# Use the following setting:
{code:title=Example}
 Root page title: Test
 Where to import: Import as a new page in the current space
 Title conflicts: Imported pages become new versions of existing pages with the same title
{code}
# Click {{Import}} button
# You will get the Oops page with the stacktrace mentioned above

h5. Screenshot
# [^DocImportBug.png]

h5. Workaround
# Please set a homepage for the space. For more information on how to do this, refer to the following documentation:
#* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+Space+Details
fields.summary: Import Word Document causes NullPointerException when a space does not have a homepage set

fields.description:
Confluence is currently running spring-2.0.8; there is a bug in 2.0.8 where a bean explicitly removed from the autowire candidates pool can be chosen for autowiring (https://jira.springframework.org/browse/SPR-4781).

This has become an issue with the web-panel default implementations that have a PluginAccessor injected through the constructor, as we have both a {{pluginAccessor}} and a {{bootstrapPluginManager}} (which has the attribute {{autowire-candidate="false"}}).

This issue is fixed in spring-2.5+, upgrading to spring-2.5.6 (same version as atlassian-plugins) would be good.
fields.summary: Upgrade confluence to Spring 2.5+

fields.description:
h4. To Reproduce
# set up a system with several thousand common names where the user names are all first-name-space-last-name like "jeff kirby". For example in our system we have dozens of users whose last or first name contains 'paul' and dozens of users whose last name contains 'ngu'.
# From a page that you have full permissions on, go to Tools | Restrictions
# Click the *Person...* search button to open users/userpicker.action
# In user details, type 'paul ngu' and click search

h4. Expected Result
The user *paul ngu* is at the top of the list or is the only result.

h4. Actual Result
*paul ngu* doesn't appear on the list. 
See !userWithSpacesSearch.png|thumbnail!


This also affects the Administration Manage Users feature.
A work around is to search by email address in the Advanced link in the userpicker but the average user, even the above average user, isn't going to do this.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20547].
  {panel}

There seems to be some inconsistencies in the edit/view page-level restriction permissions.

I searched the previously submitted bug reports and a lot of them have been resolved as "Not a bug". I at least disagree. Take the following example:

We have 2 administrators, admin1 restricts the page with the the view restriction to himself. This means that admin1 is added to the list of people who are able to view the page, all other users can not see the page except admin2 user (as he is an administrator, but he also cant see the page in the spaces page tree for example). 

Now, lets say the admin1 is on holiday and the restricted page needs editing. The admin2 user can not edit the page until he removes the restriction that admin has placed for himself. This is quite simple to do, but a small amount of unnecessary work. 

But what if there were restrictions for 10 people? What if the groups and users are retrieved through LDAP and no logical group can be used, and 10 single restrictions were required? The admin2 user would first have to remove the 10 people from the restrictions, edit the page, then add the 10 people again (since no logical LDAP group can be used) This is totally unnecessary overhaul for the administrators. Administrators should be able to edit the page even though it is restricted to whoever. Of course we could create a LDAP group with those 10 users, but this too is an overhaul that some companies can not afford, and even with this resolution, the admin2 user would first have to remove the restriction, edit the page, then add it again. 

I understand from the previous submissions that this is how it is supposed to work, that the user does not accidentally see (i.e. in the spaces pagetree view) or accidentally edit a page (a restricted edit page) that he/she isnt supposed to edit, but the administrator should be on top of this and know the details. 

To help the administrator notice the restriction, as a solution I suggest a new feature, that all restricted pages (view or edit) have a noticeable panel to the administrators that this is a restricted page, either view or edit, without removing the edit function from the page, because this creates unnecessary overhaul, one way or another.
fields.summary: Allow admin editing of restricted pages without un-restricting page

fields.description:
Ideally, we would invoke Authenticator.getUser precisely once per request, and cache and reuse that result after that. Right now, we are invoking it over a dozen times per request. Several of these calls are made even when the thread local cached copy of the user information is available and in scope. Most of the rest could be modified to use this cached copy as well.

Reducing the number of times we invoke this Authenticator will speed up our performance on LDAP, and resolve any account lockout issues we may be triggering on systems that restrict (and automatically enforce) the number of failed login attempts.
fields.summary: Authenticator.getUser is invoked too many times per request

fields.description:
When using the doc theme, if you choose Tools/Restrictions nothing happens. It seems that the AJAX request is malformed, and omits the space key. When trying in edit mode, the dialog appears, but fails when actually trying to add users/groups, for the same reason.

Additionally, when opening the Restrictions dialog from the "Restrictions" link in the page edit window, the dialog options, but none of the functionality actually works. This appears to be an additional symptom of the same problem, as the fix for the issue solves both problems.

This was fixed in 3.4 as CONF-20454

It also affects 3.3.1, but doesn't seem to be an issue in 3.3.

We should fix this before releasing 3.3.1.
fields.summary: Doc Theme is incompatible with Page Restrictions

Additional changes have been made to the Office Connector, requiring a release of the Office Connector artefacts and an upgrade to the Confluence Bundled Plugins package, before the changes will become visible in Confluence.

Note: this is the last release where this sort of ticket should be necessary. Please use the OFFCONN project from now on.
fields.summary: Release new Office Connector Version (1.13) and upload to trunk and stable

fields.description:
* Import a word document.
* On the configuration screen, change the settings, and set an empty title
* Click Import button


There is an error message: "You must enter a title."

All of the settings are reset to the default.

This is annoying, as the user has to change the title, and also redo all of the configuration. They also may not notice that the settings have been changed, and save after only correcting the title.

Instead, the settings should remain set if the user tries to save with an invalid title.
fields.summary: Doc Import: Empty page title message will reset all advanced settings

fields.description:
There's a user setting called "disable autocomplete." The description currently says:

_Disable Autocomplete in the Rich Text Editor, where it allows links to be inserted with the trigger [ and images with the trigger !._

This should be updated to include macro autocomplete which was added in 3.3. The text would read something like:
_Disable Autocomplete in the Rich Text Editor, where it allows links to be inserted with the trigger [ and images with the trigger ! *and macros with the trigger {*._


!http://img.skitch.com/20100803-q52jgur6hikahcfd566bxb6tjs.jpg!
fields.summary: Minor - update text on user settings page to include user macros

fields.description:

fields.description:
In some circumstances an attacker may be able to craft a request to a Confluence server that bypasses the additional layer of security added by the new Secure Administrator Sessions feature introduced in Confluence 3.3.

This would allow an attacker to perform administrative functions on Confluence using a hijacked session without having to re-authenticate.

This issue is rated HIGH. Please refer to [http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/VgozDQ] for information on other security related issue and more information on how we rate issues.
fields.summary: Secure Administrator Sessions feature can be bypassed

fields.description:
(i) This is from https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/PGTR-82 - I'm creating a duplicate in JAC as to add the bug in Support Bug Fix backlog.

The pagetreesearch macro can cause performance issue in large Confluence instance with complex page hierarchy.

In one reported accident, it appears to require building a lot of joints when accessing the ancestors table to determine the page hierarchy - if the hierarchy is complex enough, the reindexing process can take days to finish.

Example query:
{code}

fields.description:
When I write a number of pages that use the same images, I want to place the images on a central page. When I want to add the image from the central page to another page, I can access those central images with the !-command from the rich text editor, but not from the image browser. The draw-back being that:
(1) I have to know the name of the image
(2) I cannot add an image from the wiki markup editor

So my request is to make images from another page accessible from the image browser.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20495].
  {panel}

(related to CONF-6327)

I think this is would be an nice feature used to get an overview of task status across child pages, e.g. for meeting action items.

Let's say we have a weekly recurring important meeting. Each occurrence of the meeting gets a Wiki page, where we log the agenda, the meeting minutes and the *action items*. For the action items we use the tasklist macro.

It would be nice to be able to create an overview status page that shows just the action items from all meeting pages, to see if anything was missed. i.e. retrieve the tasklists as part of excerpt
fields.summary: Enable tasklist macro inside excerpt range

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20494].
  {panel}

In LDAP integrated Confluence, the full name and email address comes from the directory.
Probably the full name is composed from the givenName and sn attributes, as I see in the atlassian-user.xml.
However, it would be more accurate if you use the displayName attribute.
This is because some nations use reverse order in the full name.
And display name is able to contain more parts than only with sn + givenName.
In Hungary, we write the full name in "Surname Givenname" format.
Confluence displays full name in some place, for example:
* next to search field on the top of the page
* in wiki content [~loginname]
* in people directory
* and so on ...

So, it is your decision you use displayName or givenName+surName combination.

However, we would like to see our full name in the "Surname Givenname" format for our conveniences.
fields.summary: full name order

USE CASE: a user connot see a specific page in a space. There is no way to troubleshoot this problem. It would be useful having a permission tree related to users, in such a way we can understand where the permission stops the user to see pages.
Eg:
User:Fabio

see attachment.

Having this visual presentation it's immediately clear that user Fabio is preventing viewing pages starting from page C

fields.description:
As shown by CONF-20318, an upgrade task can throw an exception, but the upgrade will still complete "successfully".

In this case, the error made the instance unusable.

Instead of ignoring upgrade task errors, they should be reported to the end user. The text should report that problems were encountered during the upgrade, and the user should restore a back up and try again, and contact support if they get the same result.
fields.summary: Upgrades: Errors thrown by upgrade tasks should be reported to the end user, not ignored

fields.description:
Using the viewfile macro to display certain pages from a Powerpoint slideshow.

e.g.
{viewfile:name=PMO_Status_Report.ppt|slide=3|width=821|height=659}

Intention is to show the latest relevant slide to the project owner.

When a new version of the .ppt is attached (with same filename), the old slide content is still being rendered.

Workaround: clicking "view" on the attachment which activates the in-browser slideshow refreshes the "cache", so the macro above now shows the correct slide.

Low priority since we have a workaround, still a risk of wrong information being displayed.
fields.summary: Viewfile macro with slide number option - does not refresh when new version of Powerpoint file attached

fields.description:
When Confluence checks permissions at the group level, it retrieves all the groups a user is a member of, then looks for a matching permission against each of those groups. This performs terribly when the user is a member of a large number of groups.

Performance would almost always be better, or at least be much more predictable if you grab all the group-level permissions for the space, then perform memberOf() checks against the user for each group. (Especially in situations like LDAP where memberOf() is really cheap, but getting all groups for a user is painfully expensive)
fields.summary: Improve performance of DefaultSpacePermissionManager#hasPermissionViaGroups by reversing the way permissions are checked.

fields.description:
At the moment the {{<CONF_HOME>/attachments}} and {{<CONF_HOME>/thumbnails}} directories have two different hierarchy structures, would be good to keep these similar.

If there are enough pages creating thumbnails in Confluence, then the 32000 file limit of ext2/3 will be reached, as mentioned by G2G JP Support in a comment below.

h5. Workarounds

# Use a different filesystem with a higher file limit. ext4 has 64000 by default, and can be increased higher using "dir_nlink"
# Periodically clear out old thumbnail files so that the limit is not reached - since they are dynamically generated, the files will be repopulated as needed
fields.summary: Use similar directory hierarchy for thumbnails as for attachments

fields.description:
Confluence PDF previews are not usable for my company. Although some TrueType chinese fonts are OK, MingLiu and DFKai-SB (the two most commonly used fonts in Taiwan) are not readable. Particularly MingLiu (serif) font.

The fonts are installed on the server and xpdf (on the server) can display them OK.

From what we've found, these TrueType fonts make heavy use of hinting. We believe that the Office connector is ignoring hinting when generating PDFs. MingLiu renders perfectly when rendered using viewppt from the original PPT file

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20443].
  {panel}

Would like a site-wide option for restricting notifications to email only a link the the changed pages, not the contents of the page itself.


In our setup, our Confluence setup is secure (only available via HTTPS) but various email systems that our users use are not. Many of them use public email addresses.  


When Conflucene emails a notification of a change. It emails the entire content of the Confluence page. In effect copying what was a secure page and placing it onto the public domain.


There used to be a third party plug-in that provided this functionality but that doesn't work in version 3.3.


Sch an elementary feature should be part of Confluence especially given how email has become so insecure.


In the ole-days everyone used a company supplied server which they used to access their email that could presumably be made secure but today not all small companies operate like this anymore and allow people use their gmail.com, yahoo.com, etc. email addresses instead.


In this situation, having Confluence send only a link to the content is critical, IMHO
fields.summary: Want to be able to customize email notification to include a link to the changed items, not the contents of the Confluence page.

h2. Workaround Available

Customers experiencing this issue are now able to apply a patch to their local Confluence instances in order to resolve this problem. Additionally, an official fix for the bug will be shipped in Confluence 3.3.2 and Confluence 3.4.

This patch may be applied to all versions of Confluence after (and including) Confluence 3.2.1. Earlier versions of Confluence may not work with this patch.

h3. Patch Instructions (for Confluence Standalone)

# Download the [rendered-content.vm|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/40404/rendered-content.vm] file attached to this issue.
# Copy the file into your Confluence install directory, under {{<confluence_install>/confluence/pages}}.
# Restart Confluence.

{panel}

fields.description: I would like something like the dynamic tasklist functionality, where users are able to type simple text into a box and hit enter and that text would get appended to the bottom of the page (or some type of "section") and it doesn't require first getting edit lock, scrolling down to where you want to add, typing, hitting save, waiting for the page to reload, and then repeat. It would (I believe) allow multiple people to contribute content rapidly and in parallel. Brainstorming meetings, conference calls (or other meeting) notes... writing stuff down is slow and serialized as it stands now, unless multiple people edit multiple pages or try to deal with merging ... which takes more time. A "quick-add" capability that doesn't interfere with the conversation going on in the meeting, is basically what I'm talking about.

fields.description:
Confluence reindexing currently runs each indexing thread in its own giant transaction, meaning that for large sites there are 10 transactions that run for several hours that require transaction conflict detection & resolution, which may be a performance issue for the DB server.

On environments where database connection leaks are known to happen, administrators will enable options to enforce a transaction timeout to help the JDBC driver reclaim and close leaked connections. However, indexing threads as they stand will almost always exceed any useful timeout period, and so indexing will never complete.

This should change so that reindexing runs in a series of much smaller transactions. Smaller transactions will require less time and memory for the DB to validate, but with higher overhead for each extra transaction commit. We will need to investigate whether switching to small transactions affects indexing speed at all, and if so, what the best size is for each indexing transaction.
fields.summary: Reindexing threads should use shorter transactions

fields.description:
Reported by Nick Venegas (I was able to reproduce the same symptoms locally):

Hi

I've come across a problem in adding a gadget served from a JIRA
4.2-SNAPSHOT (via trusted apps) to Confluence 3.3.

Confluence 3.1.2 and 3.2.1_01 do not exhibit the problem:

*Steps*
1. Run JIRA 4.2-SNAPSHOT standalone
(https://jira.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/QA-ENT-717/artifact/Standalone/atlassian-jira-enterprise-4.2-SNAPSHOT)
2. Run Confluence 3.3 standalone
(http://filehost/releases/confluence/downloads/confluence-3.3-std.tar.gz)
choosing the evaluation install during setup.
3. Setup trusted apps between the two instances.
4. Add the JIRA Pie Chart gadget as an external gadget in Confluence
(e.g., http://cardinal.sydney.atlassian.com:8880/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:pie-chart-gadget/gadgets/piechart-gadget.xml)
5. In confluence, add a new page and in RTE mode, insert the JIRA pie
chart gadget.

*Expected*
- The JIRA pie chart gadget macro text should be inserted into the RTE textarea.

*Actual*
- After clicking insert at step 5, nothing is added to the RTE textarea
- Instead, there is a 403 response to a POST to
http://cardinal.sydney.atlassian.com:7073/json/convertwikimarkuptoxhtmlwithoutpagewithspacekey.action
- Adding any other macro after this 403 response also generates a 403 response.

If you use the wiki markup editor instead of the RTE, then inserting
the gadget works as normal.

I came across this when verifying the bugfix for
http://jdog.atlassian.com/browse/JRADEV-1903 (which is covered by
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-20106).

Any ideas on what is going wrong here? I'm not sure if it's a bug on
the JIRA side or not.

If you want a quick reproduction of the bug, feel free ping me and I
can setup up the instances for you to try it against.

Cheers
Nic
fields.summary: Possible bug when inserting JIRA Gadget into Confluence 3.3 Rich Text Editor

fields.description:
Related to CONF-7104 users can accidentally delete all their email from their IMAP account when adding the mail account to Confluence via

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Adding+a+Mail+Account

Most users will assume that IMAP would mean their email would not be deleted and would not read the above documentation which has the warning:

{quote}
Configured accounts (including IMAP) will have their mail downloaded and removed from the server. For more information, please refer to our [online documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Adding+a+Mail+Account]. 
{quote}



We should add this warning to the Add Mail Archive page within Confluence.
fields.summary: Add warning in Mail Archive that adding mail account will delete email even for IMAP
